Articles.Content: During the time when the server is being fixed, I was trying to record a Plants vs. Zombies video. I was trying to record a solution for the Pogo Party using CamStudio. But when I finished recording (decoder is Intel IYUV Decoder), Camstudio suddenly stopped decoding and announce a failure in decoding. All 4.00 GB of data became unusable. The next time using Microsoft Videos 1, after recording about 2.82 GB of data (10 minutes worth of data), during the decoding process Camstudio reported another failure and that 2,82 GB is dead. The third time using Intel IYUV Decoder, after recording about 10 minutes (worth 4.00 GB), during the decoding process more failure and the 4.00 GB of data became corrupt. I wonder, which recorder is more sstable recorder, and which decoder is more stable?
Have you tried Fraps? Fraps is good. I use Fraps.
I'm planning to use Screencast-O-Matic for high-quality videos, but it only got to 15 minutes per video. (I'm using the free version.)
